#Text=Condemned To Torture and Death
#Text=La had followed her company and when she saw them clawing and biting at Tarzan , she raised her voice and cautioned them not to kill him .
#Text=She saw that he was weakening and that soon the greater numbers would prevail over him , nor had she long to wait before the mighty jungle creature lay helpless and bound at her feet .
#Text=" Bring him to the place at which we stopped , " she commanded and they carried Tarzan back to the little clearing and threw him down beneath a tree .
#Text=" Build me a shelter ! " ordered La.
#Text=" We shall stop here tonight and tomorrow in the face of the Flaming God , La will offer up the heart of this defiler of the temple .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=But no one had seen it and each was positive in his assurance that the sacrificial weapon had not been upon Tarzan 's person when they captured him .

#Text= Where is the knife ? " La asked him .

column1: #Text=" I do not know , " replied Tarzan .
#Text=" The man took it with him when he slipped away during the night .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=La laughed a bitter laugh , for in her heart she knew that Tarzan 's sin was greater than the purloining of the sacrificial knife of Opar ; yet as she looked at him lying bound and helpless before her , tears rose to her eyes so that she had to turn away to hide them ; but she remained inflexible in her determination to make him pay in frightful suffering and in eventual death for daring to spurn the love of La.

#Text=Gather wood well filled with pitch , lay it in the form and size of the altar at Opar in the center of the clearing that the Flaming God may look down upon our handiwork and be pleased .

_	_	_	_

#Text= Tonight ! " she thought .

column1: #Text=" Tonight , when it is dark I will torture him . "

#Text=She looked upon his perfect , godlike figure and upon his handsome , smiling face and then she steeled her heart again by thoughts of her love spurned ; by religious thoughts that damned the infidel who had desecrated the holy of holies ; who had taken from the blood-stained altar of Opar the offering to the Flaming God -- and not once but thrice .
#Text=Three times had Tarzan cheated the god of her fathers .
#Text=At the thought La paused and knelt at his side .
#Text=In her hand was a sharp knife .
#Text=She placed its point against the ape-man 's side and pressed upon the hilt ; but Tarzan only smiled and shrugged his shoulders .
#Text=How beautiful he was !
#Text=La bent low over him , looking into his eyes .
#Text=How perfect was his figure .
#Text=She compared it with those of the knurled and knotted men from whom she must choose a mate , and La shuddered at the thought .
#Text=Dusk came and after dusk came night .
#Text=A great fire blazed within the little thorn boma about the camp .
#Text=The flames played upon the new altar erected in the center of the clearing , arousing in the mind of the High Priestess of the Flaming God a picture of the event of the coming dawn .
#Text=She saw this giant and perfect form writhing amid the flames of the burning pyre .
#Text=She saw those smiling lips , burned and blackened , falling away from the strong , white teeth .
#Text=She saw the shock of black hair tousled upon Tarzan 's well-shaped head disappear in a spurt of flame .
#Text=She saw these and many other frightful pictures as she stood with closed eyes and clenched fists above the object of her hate --
#Text=ah !
#Text=was it hate that La of Opar felt ?
